en: O Israel, return unto Jehovah thy God; for thou hast fallen by thine iniquity.
hmr: Aw Israel, LALPA i Pathien tienga chun kîr nâwk rawh, I rîtlona lei ngei chun i tlu ta hi.

en: Take with you words, and return unto Jehovah: say unto him, Take away all iniquity, and accept that which is good: so will we render as bullocks the offering of our lips.
hmr: Thu chawi pumin LALPA kuom tieng kîr nâwk la, A kuoma chun hieng ang hin hril rawh, “Rîtlona po po chu la hmang la, A ṭha taphawt chu pawm la, Chuongchun, kan hmûr rahai chu, Bâwngchal aiah hung inhlân kan tih.

en: Assyria shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses; neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, Ye are our gods; for in thee the fatherless findeth mercy.
hmr: Assuria chun mi sandam naw nih a, Sakawr chunghaia chun chuong nâwng kan ta, Kan kutsuokhai kuoma chun, ‘Kan Pathien in nih,’ ti ngai ta nâwng kan tih, Fahrahai chun nangmaa hin Lunginsietna an lo hmu hlak a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely; for mine anger is turned away from him.
hmr: An hnungtawlna hi sukdam ka ta, Annia inthawka ka lungin- senna chu ân kieng ta leiin, Anni chu ka hmangai hrim hrim ding a nih.

en: I will be as the dew unto Israel; he shall blossom as the lily, and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.
hmr: Israel kuoma chun daidaw ang nîng ka ta, Ama chu lili angin hung vul a ta, Lebanon tlânga thing zung angin a zung thlâk dar a tih.

en: His branches shall spread, and his beauty shall be as the olive-tree, and his smell as Lebanon.
hmr: A zârhai chu inbuk luoi a ta, A mawizie chu oliv thing ang el nîng a tih; Lebanon tlâng ang elin a rim inhnik a tih.

en: They that dwell under his shadow shall return; they shall revive as the grain, and blossom as the vine: the scent thereof shall be as the wine of Lebanon.
hmr: A hlima chênghai chu hung kîr an ta, Bu ang hring thar an tih, Grêp hrui angin hung inno an ta; A rim inhnikzie chu Lebanon uoin ang nîng a tih.

en: Ephraim shall say, What have I to do any more with idols? I have answered, and will regard him: I am like a green fir-tree; from me is thy fruit found.
hmr: Aw Ephraim, milimhai leh inzâwlna ieng am ka nei a? Kei hi a suklâwmtu che ka na, A tungdingtu che khawm ka nih. Kei chu fâr thing hring dup ang ka na, I ra ṭhahai chu keima kuoma inthawk a nih.

en: Who is wise, that he may understand these things? prudent, that he may know them? for the ways of Jehovah are right, and the just shall walk in them; but transgressors shall fall therein.
hmr: Tu am vara hieng hi hrethiem thei ding? Tu am var hlea hre thei ding? LALPA lampuihai chu an indik a; Mi indikhai chun an hraw ding a ni sih a; Bawsetuhai ruok chu chutaka chun An insui thlu ding a nih.
